$Log: do-partition.xml,v $ Revision 1.7 2012/11/13 23:27:50 clem When creating a RAID array use the proper hostname
We need to set the hostname before creating a RAID array so that the RAID metadata contains the proper hostname (at this point the installed host hostname is localhost.localdomain).
If the raid is dinamically created in a second moment and the hostname in the metadata does not correspond with the local hostname the RAID sub-system thinks that the RAID is an external RAID (imported from another machine) and creates it with another name (not the standard md0/md1 but md127/md126)
